instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message:
Hi All,

This board is not a liquid damaged. Board is clean.

using all 4 usb ports can charge. But only right side ports work for usb funstions.

Left side No light on usb-c adaptors but can the macbook charge.

Can you give a point where to start with?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message: Tried with another USB-C board still same. left side both ports no USB functions.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message: Inspect area of <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/3200 chips more closely, maybe there is some corrosion you have missed. I would replace them both too as they are USB-C contollers. Also inspect J3300 and components around for corrosion or damages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message:
HI , Thank you for your quick reply. 
My question is as i get 20v and and charging with out any issue, should i touch <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>,3200? 
I thought <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> works dierectly with J3300 in regards to USB functions. Please correct me if im wrong. Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message: Also J3300 and around components pretty clean and no burnt caps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message:
If the problem is related with <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200, then check the voltage at L3500.
You should get 5V there, when an USB device is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message: Hi 2info, I get only 0.2v with USB adaptor connected on L3500. DIode mode 0.166v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> voltage, pins 15, 19, 20, 7.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R3509</RESISTOR>/39 and <CAPACITOR>C3516</CAPACITOR> are all good.
You can compare values in diode mode around <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> with UB700.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message: <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>, pin 15 3.3v, 19,20,7 0v. Compare with working board <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> diode mode values are same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message: my bad. pin 19,20 get 5V, so <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> is present. Missing voltage on pin 7.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message: pin 19 voltage hold only for couple of sec.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LEFT USBC  Charing but No USB funstions. Right side works fine.
threads.message:
You don't need another board.
UB700 area is the same as <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>.
For voltage comparison, you MUST connect USB device to corresponding ports.
Enable signal will come high only if a device is detected.
